ygData.subject: Re: THE MINIONS OF UNICRON HAVE COME!

Your right, and my attempt is not to mod, but since he was looking in
that direction it was only logical. As far as the base and such, sorry
I gave it more credit then I meant too. I guess I was just using
Rodimus to clue everyone else in on what is happeneing. I apologize if
this is causing a problem for anyone. If ANYONE has any problems with
the way I am doing this or the direction it is going. Feel free to
write me on or off the list. 

Enjoy

Preston

--- Kraftlos <kraftlos@...> wrote:

> OOC: Just a few technical questions before I reply to this post...
> what
> communication towers are you talking about?  Also, the base's
> computers will
> detect the missles but they wont set of an alarm in the base, the
> security
> systems are not connected to the scanner.  I need to stress that the
> Pasificus base is really low-tech.  (that's not to say that Atlantis'
> alarms
> might now be going off around the city - which I'll have happen in my
> next
> post).
> 
> One last note, be careful not to write for other people's characters
> and
> property.  For example, the owner of Rodimus would have had to give
> you
> permission for you to tell us what he's seeing, same with describing
> what
> Trelos is doing and how the base reacts to the missile.  I have no
> problem
> with what's happening in the story, but this is one of the main rules
> of
> Play by Email rpg's; its called moding, and at one time was forbidden
> by the
> rules of this group.  You can say the missiles fly toward the towers
> or
> characters, but you cannot say the result of the attack in the same
> post.
> I'm sorry that I haven't found a rules-section to place on the wiki
> yet.
> Again, no harm-no foul.   Just try to be careful not to overreach
> your
> scope.  :P
> 
> On 10/25/07, supercyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
> >
> >   From the brightening side of the moon a large wave of something
> rose
> > from its surface. Red like the landscape it flew from, it rose into
> > the air. Then with a smooth twist of hue it turned black as the
> > shadows of space enveloped it. Like some black fog hunter-
> > terminators, or sweeps as some call them, along with their leader
> > Scourge, gathered themselves under the direction of the mighty
> > Cyclonus. Then with lightening swiftness boosters flared turning
> the
> > surface of the moon crimson for the briefest of moments before they
> > struck out across open space, moving with precision and ease toward
> > the unsuspecting inhabitants of the earth.
> >
> > Inside the pacifist Maximal base in Atlantis the computers
> continued
> > to monitor the grounds, primarily attempting to keep track of the
> > fleeing Trelos. But as always a few cones were pointed skyward,
> > always on the look out for Minions. What they saw today the
> computers
> > had no way to understand. Something that was there and yet not
> there.
> > The slightest bit of distortion, that under normal circumstances
> > would have been ignored, but in this case was large, and worse yet,
> > it was moving. (OOC: Think of Predator's invisibility when he
> moved)
> >
> > A yellow warning light began to go off in the pacifist command
> > center, as the computer screen automatically projected course and
> > heading. Approximated heading: Atlantis. Unfortunately no one was
> > there to notice.
> >
> > On the grounds of Atlantis the pursuit of Trelos continues as
> several
> > Maximals attempt to retrieve the rather elusive Predacon from his
> > newest hiding spot, underwater. One boat is on the water obviously
> > searching, while a floating car hovers over the waters doing its
> own
> > search. Meanwhile Rodimus has noted a rather odd dot in the skies,
> > one that he can see to be a Predacon eagle. He is pointing at it.
> And
> > even as he is doing this he notes something strange coming from
> > behind the eagle. The sky for a moment seems to flash and ripple,
> > almost like lightning, and yet there is a slight rotation to the
> > flashes.
> >
> > In the skies above the eagle looks down noting Rodimus pointing at
> > him, and he begins to drop out of the skies moving out over open
> > water, preparing either to flee, or do a strafing run. In either
> case
> > he is totally unaware of what is transpiring over his head.
> >
> > On the grounds below Rodimus can see what is coming as his enhanced
> > vision sees two very tiny dots spiraling out from the rippling
> > flashes. At the same time Klaxons begin to go off as base computers
> > do actually recognize this threat: MISSILES!
> >
> > Erupting out of the skies, twin missiles streak across the skies,
> > vortexes of flames spiraling after them like crimson, cone shaped
> > contrails. They slam into communication towers, and the towers as
> > well as a few outlying buildings burst into flames.
> >
> > In the background, almost unnoticed, a Myrmidon spirals out of the
> > skies, the recipient of several laser blasts. Small gouts of flames
> > flowing from him even as he impacts the water. Myrmidon sinks
> beneath
> > the waves.
> >
> > And flying from amidst this bombardment Cyclonus rises high into
> the
> > air.
> >
> > "The days you have known are over. All that you have belongs to us!
> > Resist and be destroyed!! THE MINIONS OF UNICRON HAVE COME!"
> >
> > Even Cyclonus spoke sweeps arrive seeming to almost darken the
> skies
> > for a momsnt, disintegrator blasts providing bright flashes of
> light
> > as they bath Atlantis and the Maximal base in war.
> >
> > - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
> >
> > OOC: I am sure other Maximal and Predacon bases/HQ's will note
> > something similar to what the Maximal base in Atlantis noted, feel
> > free for anyone to jump in, if it makes sense.
> >
> > The only thing of note is that the Sweeps and Scourge cannot be
> > locked on to with sensors (check out their profiles on wiki). That
> > should not affect most of you very much, since most of you shoot by
> > sight anyways, unless you are using base sensors or some remote
> > sensing capability.
> >
> > Also any Minions that chose to come with are in this group as well.
> >
> >  
> >
>
